comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Pleas use InjectionHelper as InstanceManager is really verbose.
Change getLeaveRequestService(), getSelectedLeavePlanPersistenceService(), getServiceAgreementCaseService(), getLeavePlanSearchService(), getApplicabilityService(), getSelectionResultPersistenceService() as well, as they are all wrong.
If should be like following, which is much more terse
private ProxySupportService getProxySupportService() { return proxySupportService = InjectionHelper.getInjectable(proxySupportService, ProxySupportService.class); }
Currently there is 100 lines of boilerplate for getting the services

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment:
I know we could put the block of code in:
paidLeaveInstruction.setSelectedLeavePlan(selectedLeavePlan); times = 1;
as part of Expectation (we'd have the same result) but I think it's so much clear (readability) when you have the following flow in a Test:
* Mocking your dependencies (expectations) * Method under test execution * Verification (Asserts and verifications times)

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Javadoc on these isXXXX() methods is fairly poor. It give no mention of what it checks for "is known" and hence you (the developer) were checking the wrong field in the previous revision. If author can get it wrong, what hope for someone else without good documentation?!
Can you update javadocs for isXXX to say what is checks e.g. isNotMet() has javadoc saying "true if the Selected Leave Plan is Not met" - what does that mean - "not met" against what? It makes no sense to the reader. It should say "true if the Selected Leave Plan has an eligibility result type of "Not Met", false otherwise etc.
Apply this to all isXXXX methods
